title: Jamaican Curry Chicken
directions: Season chicken with, salt, pepper or creole seasoning and set aside
In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat, until hot, and then add the chicken and brown on both sides about 3-5 minutes until chicken is brown.
Remove chicken and set aside. Drain oil and leave about 2 tablespoons

Add onions, followed by minced garlic, thyme, smoked paprika, curry powder, stir for about 5 minutes, for the flavors to blossom, then add coconut milk, bay leaf and tomato paste, continue cooking for another 2 minutes. Then add about 2-3 cups water .Add chicken, salt and cook for about 15minutes
Gently throw in potatoes, followed by carrots and green beans last. Cook until potatoes are tender- 7 minutes or more. Add chopped parsley.
Adjust sauce thickness and seasoning with water or broth, salt according to preference.
ingredients: 1 ½ teaspoon seasoned salt (I used creole seasoning)
2 teaspoons minced garlic or 1 tablespoon garlic powder
500gm potatoes or more peeled cut in medium pieces
